intro: Festuca elatior var. fallax, commonly known as fallax fescue, is a cool-season grass native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its fine, grass-like foliage and forms dense, compact clumps. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often used in ornamental landscaping for its durability and aesthetic appeal. Festuca elatior var. fallax is also valued for its ability to tolerate partial shade and moderate drought conditions.
